medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Eight months before admission, the patient had an episode with stiffened and extended arms, falling backward, and recovering within seconds. These episodes began occurring three to four times daily during waking hours, with occasional incontinence and loss of muscle tone. Over subsequent months, feeding became slow, necessitating soft foods, and the patient lost 5 kg. Interaction with his mother decreased progressively, and the frequency of episodes increased to 5 to 10 times daily. The patient became fearful of falling backward and switched from walking to crawling.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient experienced developmental delays as evidenced by limited vocabulary and understanding of speech compared to his brother. He had repeated bouts of tonsillitis, which led to tonsillectomy at age four. His cognitive and motor functions declined over the two years prior to admission.
medical_history.family_history: Parents were first cousins. No family history of neurologic disease.
medical_history.social_history: The family resided in a Middle Eastern country.
